Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_set_sample_info

The function AIL_set_sample_info initializes a sample's address, length, type, and flags to prepare for playback of a memory-resident sound data.

S32 AIL_set_sample_info(
  HSAMPLE S,
  AILSOUNDINFO const * const *info
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample to prepare for playback.
info
is a structure that contains format and address information about a sound buffer.

Returns

0 if the file could not be parsed; otherwise, a non-zero return value indicates the sample handle was successfully prepared for file playback.

Discussion

This function sets up an HSAMPLE based on the values in the AILSOUNDINFO structure. You will usually get an AILSOUNDINFO structure from the AIL_WAV_info function.

This function can load MPEG Layer-3 data if the format field in the AILSOUNDINFO structure is set to 85 (the standard Windows MP3 wave file id). AIL_WAV_info only parses wave files, so to play standard MP3 files (not wave wrapped), you'll have to initialize the AILSOUNDINFO structure yourself (since AIL_WAV_info only parses wave files) - or just use AIL_set_named_sample_file.

This function is handy as a mirror of the AIL_set_3D_sample_info function in the 3D digital sound API.
